Package gameWorld

Class GameWorld

java.lang.Object
gameWorld.GameWorld
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class GameWorld
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
The GameWorld is the World composed of the Dungeon, and the Hero selected by the Player when the world was created.

There are two important variable, the current Floor and the current Room, that allows the player to move in the dungeon.

See Also:
Serialized Form

    Updates the music playing to match the theme of the room, and changes the volume

  • Constructor Details

    • GameWorld

      public GameWorld​(Hero hero, java.lang.String saveName, int numberFloor)
      Constructs a new GameWorlds, whose Hero is specified by the Hero argument.
      Parameters:
      hero - the Hero of the GameWorld
      saveName - the file the game will be saved to
      numberFloor - the number of floor the game will have
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - unless both hero and saveName aren't null.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - unless the number of Floor is greater than 0.

  • Method Details

    • processUserInput

      public void processUserInput()
      Processes every input from the Player.

    • gameOver

      public boolean gameOver()
      Returns the game state, whether it's game over or not.
      Returns:
      true if the player lost the game, false otherwise.

    • updateMusic

      public void updateMusic()
      Updates the music playing to match the theme of the room, and changes the volume

    • updateGameWorld

      public void updateGameWorld()
      Updates the gameWorld with all the cooldowns.
